snippet: Back in 1994, after he won election as treasurer of California, Matt Fong had some campaign money left over. So he sent a $50,000 check to a conservative Orange County group, the Traditional Values Coalition, which was promoting a ballot initiativ...
lead_paragraph: Back in 1994, after he won election as treasurer of California, Matt Fong had some campaign money left over. So he sent a $50,000 check to a conservative Orange County group, the Traditional Values Coalition, which was promoting a ballot initiative to ban same-sex marriage in California, a ban he favored. Now that gift has come back to haunt Mr. Fong, a moderate Republican who this fall is trying to unseat Senator Barbara Boxer, a liberal Democrat.
abstract: California Republican State Treasurer Matt Fong, who is in tight race to unseat incumbent Demnocrat Sen Barbara Boxer in election for Senate seat from California, is embarrassed by disclosure that he gave $50,000 to Traditional Values Coalition, conservative anti-gay group in Orange County, in 1994 (S)

headline.main: Gift Comes Back To Haunt Candidate
